thread.title: Engineers squander late lead
thread.title_full: Engineers squander late lead - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: Engineers squander late lead
text:
Alaska-Anchorage scored two goals in less than three minutes early in the third period to overcome a 3-2 deficit and post a 4-3 victory over RPI in the opening round of the Brice Alaska Goal Rush in Fairbanks, Alaska on Friday night.
The Engineers, now 1-2, will face the hosts from Alaska-Fairbanks on Saturday at 11:07 p.m. ET.
RPI scored twice in the second period to take a 2-1 lead. Evan Tironese and Meirs Moore tallied the goals for the Engineers.
After the Seawolves tied the score one minute, 24 seconds into the final period, RPI grabbed a 3-2 lead four minutes later on Milos Bubela's short-handed goal.
But then the Seawolves took over. Jarrett Brown scored an unassisted power-play goal 7:12 into the third stanza to tie the score at 3.
At 10:09 of the period, Wyatt Ege put the Seawolves in front 4-3.
RPI goaltender Jason Kasdorf , who has started all three games for the Engineers, finished with 23 saves. Alaska-Anchorage's Olivier Mantha had 27 saves.
More Information
ALASKA-ANCHORAGE 4, RPI 3
RPI 0 2 1—3
Alaska Anchorage 1 0 3—4
First period—1, AA, Hubbs (Amantea, Anholt) 14:21. Penalties—None.
Second period—2, RPI, Tironese (Nanne, Wilson) 4:59; 3, RPI, Moore (1) PP (Prapavessis, Ohrvall) 11:56. Penalties—Azurdia, AA (tripping) 7:57; Brown, AA (kneeing) 10:19; Schroeder, RPI (diving) 12:51; Bubela, RPI (high sticking) 16:20.
Third period—4, AA, Azurdia (1) (Dusyk) 1:24; 5, RPI, Bubela SH (Schroeder, Prapavessis); 6, AA, Brown PP (unassisted) 7:12; 7, AA, Ege (Van Allen). Penalties—Bubela, RPI (hooking) 1:45; Clary, RPI (boarding) 5:14; Tatchell, AA (tripping) 5:52; Nanne, RPI (tripping) 5:56; Tironese, RPI (slashing) 6:28; Mitchell, AA (high sticking) 6:28.
Shots on goal—RPI 9-12-9—30; Alaska Anchorage 10-6-11—27.
Power-play opportunities—RPI 1 of 2; Alaska Anchorage 1 of 5.
Goalies—RPI, Kasdorf 9-6-8 (27 shots-23 saves); Alaska Anchorage, Mantha, Player 9-10-8 (30-27). A— N/A. T— 2:06.
RPI outshot the Seawolves, 30-27.
